Redfield's Sports Bar / Deli | floor_area = | floors = 40 | height = {{convert|151.4|m|abbr=on}} | parking = | website = [http://manchestergrand.hyatt.com/ manchestergrand.hyatt.com] | footnotes = {{emporis|118062}}{{skyscraperpage|6825}}{{structurae|s0045714}} }} '''Manchester Grand Hyatt Hotel''' is a high-rise building in [[San Diego]] composed of two towers. The towers are the third and seventh tallest buildings in the city. Developed but no longer owned by the controversial San Diego developer, [[Doug Manchester]],{{cite news | author=Fred Karger | title=First Anniversary of Boycott Against Doug Manchester | url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/fred-karger/first-anniversary-of-boyc_b_239054.html | work=The Huffington Post | date=July 18, 2009 | accessdate=24 August 2010}} the tower is the tallest building on the waterfront on the West Coast, and with 1,625 rooms, it is [[Southern California]]'s largest hotel.{{cite news | url=http://www.californiachronicle.com/articles/view/109434 | title=Make a Grand Entrance - Rappel 33 Stories from the Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego | work=The California Chronicle | accessdate=2009-07-20}} Because of its proximity to the waterfront, as well as its amenities, the Manchester Grand Hyatt is referred to as a spa and [[resort]].{{cite web|url=http://www.sandiego.org/listing/Visitors/2775|title=Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego | publisher=San Diego Convention & Visitors Bureau|accessdate=2009-07-20}} ==Description== The Manchester Grand Hyatt consists of two towers, the 40-story Harbor Tower built in 1992 and the 33-story Seaport Tower which was added in 2003, prompted by the positive response to the space already allocated for private meetings.{{cite news | url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-22087866_ITM |title=Expanded Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego now is hotel on Southern California coast| work=Los Angeles Business Journal|accessdate=2009-07-20 | date=2004-07-05}} A four-story building with a rooftop pool connects the towers to each other. The hotel's 1,625 guest rooms each have partial water or city views, and many offer [[panorama|panoramic]] vistas of the [[Pacific Ocean]]. All rooms are equipped with [[Wi-Fi]] Internet access, and [[iPod]] docking stations.{{cite news |url=http://entertainment.signonsandiego.com/places/manchester-grand-hyatt/ | title=Manchester Grand Hyatt |work=The San Diego Union-Tribune | accessdate=2009-07-20}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} The hotel has two bars: the Top of the Hyatt and the Grand Lobby Bar.{{cite web| url=http://manchestergrand.hyatt.com/hyatt/hotels/entertainment/lounges/index.jsp| title=Lounges/Bars| publisher=Hyatt Corporation| accessdate=2009-07-20}} The third floor holds the hotel pool and the Kin Spa. ===Top of the Hyatt=== The 40th and top floor of the Manchester Grand Hyatt is known as the Top of the Hyatt. Instead of a traditional [[Penthouse apartment|penthouse suite]], former hotel owner Doug Manchester decided to create an upscale bar with panoramic views of [[San Diego]], [[Coronado Island]], and [[Mexico]].{{cite news | url=http://www.signonsandiego.com/feature/495/nye/hotels.html | title=New Year's Eve| work=The Union-Tribune|accessdate=2009-07-20}} The bar was awarded the title of "Best Upscale Bar" by ''SignOnSanDiego'', and is considered, "an unparalleled spot from which to watch the sunset."{{cite web |url=http://www.sandiego.org/listing/Visitors/1585 | title=Top of the Hyatt - Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego | publisher=San Diego Convention & Visitors Bureau | accessdate=2009-07-20}}{{cite news |url=http://travel.latimes.com/destinations/san-diego/nightlife-spots/top-of-the-hyatt/review |title=San Diego Nightlife Spots | work=The Los Angeles Times | accessdate=2009-07-20 |first=Christopher |last=Reynolds}} ===Kin Oasis=== Kin Oasis is the new adult-only pool (ages 21 above) located on the third floor of Harbor Tower. The rooftop pool, described as "upscale", includes [[bottle service]], [[cabana]] rentals, and hosts large pool parties on holiday weekends in conjunction with [[Fortune Industries]].{{cite news |url=http://entertainment.signonsandiego.com/places/kin-lounge/|title=Kin Lounge| last=Chinn |first=Derrik | work=The San Diego Union-Tribune | accessdate=2009-07-20}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{cite web|url=http://sd.napkinnights.com/vd/kin_lounge|title= Kin Lounge| work=NapkinNights|accessdate=2009-07-20}} ==Location== The Manchester Grand Hyatt is located on the [[Gaslamp Quarter, San Diego|Gaslamp Quarter]]âs waterfront, a few blocks away from the Gaslamp Quarter, [[Seaport Village]], as well as the [[San Diego Convention Center]].{{cite web |url=http://www.hotelscombined.com/Hotel/Manchester_Grand_Hyatt_Hotel_San_Diego.htm |title=Manchester Grand Hyatt Hotel San Diego |publisher=Hotels Combined |accessdate=2009-07-20}} The [[San Diego Trolley]] stops near the hotel which connects to several lines to reach the majority of the San Diego metropolitan area. The hotel is located less than a mile from [[Petco Park]], an [[Amtrak]] train station, and [[Woodbury University]]'s San Diego campus.{{cite web |url=http://arestravel.com/372_hotel-location-info_h100.html |title=Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego |work=GoThere |accessdate=2009-07-20}} ==Proposition 8 controversy== Doug Manchester, chairman of Manchester Financial Group,{{cite web |url=http://www.dougmanchester.com/ |title=Papa Doug Manchester |k=Doug Manchester|accessdate=2009-07-20}} sparked controversy in 2008 when he backed California's [[California Proposition 8 (2008)|Proposition 8]] with financial support in the amount of $125,000.{{cite web |url=http://www.sdcitybeat.com/cms/story/detail/bonnie_vs_the_manchester_hyatt/7772/ |title=Bonnie vs. the Manchester Hyatt |last=Lamb|first=John R. | work=San Diego CityBeat |accessdate=2009-07-20}} The money was donated before Proposition 8 was a ballot [[initiative]]. Before a proposition can be officially placed on a ballot for voter consideration, 700,000 signatures need to be gathered. Supporters of the proposition used the $125,000 Manchester donated to pay professionals to acquire signatures in an effort to solidify the initiative's place on the [[ballot]]. When asked about his contribution, Manchester was quoted as saying, "When they say that we cannot say that a marriage is between a man and a woman, that's where I draw the line."{{cite web|url=http://www.signonsandiego.com/news/metro/20080315-9999-1m15samesex.html|title=Developer is foe of same-sex marriage|last=Ainsworth|first=Bill |work=The San Diego Union-Tribune |accessdate=2009-07-20}} While Manchester has admitted that he "supports" his employees who are gay and lesbian, he cites the fact that he is [[Catholic]] as a motivation behind his actions. ===Boycott=== The support caused an immediate response from [[List of LGBT rights organizations|gay-rights organizations]], including [[Gay & Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation|GLAAD]], which canceled all events planned for the hotel. [[Trade union|Labor unions]], including Hotel Workers Union Local 30, publicly admonished Manchester for his actions, with one member describing Proposition 8 as "pure and simple [[discrimination]]."{{cite web|url=http://www.10news.com/news/16848234/detail.html|title=Gay Rights Leaders Urge Boycott Of Manchester Grand Hyatt|publisher=CNN|accessdate=2009-07-20}} In addition, a [[Protests against Proposition 8 supporters|boycott from Proposition 8 protesters]] quickly followed.{{cite web|url=http://www.cbs8.com/Global/story.asp?S=10747593|title=Protestors Plan New Year Of Manchester Boycott|publisher=CBS8|accessdate=2009-07-20}} The [[boycott]] was originally intended to last one year, but subsequent protests of other Hyatt locations continued after that duration.{{cite web |url=http://www.sfbaytimes.com/?sec=article&article_id=10525|title=NY Governor Introduces Bill to Legalize Same-Sex Marriage |last=Wockner|first=Rex |work=The San Francisco Bay Times |accessdate=2009-07-20}} Also in turn some gay and lesbian employees of the hotel resigned in protest. When Manchester was the owner of the Manchester Grand Hyatt, the [[Global Hyatt|Global Hyatt Corporation]] attempted to separate his views from that of the managing corporation. Global Hyatt contended that Manchester did not speak on its behalf and that the corporation has a proven history of supporting [[LGBT rights by country or territory|gay and lesbian rights]]. In addition, the Global Hyatt Corporation issued a statement that asserts many Hyatt hotels, including the Manchester Grand Hyatt, offer benefits to [[Domestic partnership|domestic partners]] of employees,{{cite web|url=http://www.nsba.org/conference/hotel/hyatt_update.cfm|title=San Diego Hyatt Update|publisher=National School Boards Association|accessdate=2009-07-20}} which is optional for businesses. [[Californians Against Hate]], a gay-rights activist group, has estimated that the boycott resulted in a loss of over $7 million, despite Manchester's attempt to reach out to the gay community with room credits and donations.{{cite news |url=http://www.sandiego6.com/news/local/story/Manchester-Grand-Hyatt-Reaches-Out-to-Gay-Groups/yeveNOls6EejuVRdjLvgLg.cspx |title=Manchester Grand Hyatt Reaches Out to Gay Groups; Boycott Continues |last=Michaelson |first=Elex | work=San Diego 6 |accessdate=2009-07-20}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} The [[Marketing management|marketing manager]] for the hotel, Kelly Commerford, has confirmed that cancellations resulting directly from the protest cost the hotel $2.4 million.{{cite web |url=http://www.sdbj.com/industry_article.asp?aID=77915344.420788.1719497.2939526.5791829.446&aID2=132260 |title=Union Local Fears Loss of Jobs If Grand Hyatt Is Sold |last=Lewis |first=Connie | work=San Diego Business Journal |accessdate=2009-07-29}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} This figure does not include estimates for those who choose other accommodations due to the boycott. The developer, Manchester, claimed that the boycotting unions are using gay marriage support as a screen "to cover [their] real goal of organizing" the hotel's workers. The hotel was sold near the end of May 2011 to Host Hotels and Resorts, thus severing Manchester's financial ties to it.{{cite news| url=http://www.bizjournals.com/washington/news/2011/03/24/host-hotels-resorts-closes-on.html | date=2011-03-24 | first=Tucker | last=Echols | title=Host Hotels & Resorts closes on Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego and New York Helmsley Hotel acquisitions}} ==See also== *[[List of tallest buildings in San Diego]] ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://manchestergrand.hyatt.com/hyatt/hotels/index.jsp Manchester Grand Hyatt homepage] [[Category:Residential buildings completed in 1992]] [[Category:Skyscrapers in San Diego, California]] [[Category:Skyscrapers between 100 and 149 meters]] [[Category:Hotels in California]] [[Category:Hyatt]] [[es:Manchester Grand Hyatt Hotel]] [[fr:Manchester Grand Hyatt Hotel]]
